conditions_required: Cheating is a cognizable offence; FIR must be registered when accused is identified
Send legal notice when attempting civil recovery alongside or before criminal complaint
File private criminal complaint if police refuses to register FIR
File civil suit for recovery if criminal route is not viable or to supplement it
Seek police protection if accused is threatening to repeat fraud or cause harm
Minor cheating where property not delivered; still cognizable hence FIR first
Private complaint if police refuses to register FIR for minor cheating
Breach of trust is cognizable; FIR must be filed immediately on discovery
Legal notice demanding return of entrusted property before or alongside criminal case
Civil suit for recovery of entrusted property if criminal proceedings are delayed
Private complaint before Magistrate if police refuses FIR registration
Theft is cognizable; FIR is first and mandatory action immediately after theft
Apply for police protection if accused or their associates are threatening complainant
Punishment section accompanies 378; FIR always filed for both sections together
Snatching is cognizable and FIR must be registered at nearest police station immediately
Apply for police protection if accused has threatened to snatch or harm again
Domestic cruelty by husband is cognizable; FIR can be filed by wife or her relatives
File DV complaint under PWDVA simultaneously for civil reliefs including residence order
Seek police protection or protection order from court during pendency of case
Apply for restraining injunction against husband if there is immediate threat
Husband may apply for anticipatory bail anticipating arrest under 498A
If husband is arrested bail application to be filed by his counsel
Cognizable and non-bailable; FIR under 304B to be registered immediately
If case involves false evidence or tampering file perjury complaint against witnesses
Murder is cognizable non-bailable; FIR must be registered immediately
Private complaint where police has closed case or delayed investigation
Accused may apply for anticipatory bail in cases where arrest feared before FIR
Accused after arrest must file regular bail application though unlikely to succeed in murder
Attempt to murder is cognizable non-bailable; FIR first mandatory action
NC complaint for minor incidents where attempt element is borderline
Immediate police protection for victim as accused likely to attempt again
Restraining injunction against accused from approaching victim
File defamation suit in civil court for damages and injunction against publication
File criminal complaint before Magistrate for criminal defamation under IPC 500
Send legal notice demanding retraction and apology before filing suit
Apply for interim injunction to stop further publication of defamatory material
File criminal complaint in Magistrate court for punishment of defamer
Send legal notice before initiating criminal proceedings for defamation
Forgery is cognizable; FIR must be filed immediately upon discovering forged document
Private criminal complaint before Magistrate if police declines FIR
File suit for cancellation of forged sale deed or other forged document simultaneously
Forgery of valuable security is cognizable non-bailable; FIR immediately
File civil suit to cancel the forged document and restore property to rightful owner
Forgery for cheating; FIR is primary action; cognizable offence
Using forged document; FIR to be filed when forged document is presented
Forgery FIR must be filed at police station as cognizable offence
Criminal intimidation is cognizable; FIR to be filed at local police station
Apply for police protection simultaneously when threats to life are received
Restraining order application against accused to prevent further threats
FIR for criminal intimidation as cognizable offence
Legal notice putting accused on notice that threats will lead to legal action
Anonymous threat FIR must seek CDR investigation to trace source of threat
File perjury complaint when false evidence is given in judicial proceedings
File criminal complaint before Magistrate under Section 191/193 for perjury
File criminal complaint for fabrication of false evidence before Magistrate
Punishment for false evidence; file through criminal complaint to Magistrate
Rape is cognizable non-bailable; FIR mandatory; zero FIR can be filed at any station
Immediate police protection for victim as accused may threaten victim or witnesses
Accused may apply for anticipatory bail though courts are reluctant to grant in rape
Cognizable offence; FIR to be filed at police station; cannot be refused
Apply for police protection if accused is known to victim and threats continue
File complaint with Women's Commission for expedited action and support
Sexual harassment is cognizable; FIR to be registered
File POSH complaint with Internal Complaints Committee if workplace harassment
Approach Women's Commission for support and action against harasser
Stalking is cognizable; FIR to be registered especially for repeat stalking
Apply for restraining order against stalker to prevent approaching victim
Police protection particularly if stalker is violent or threatening
Kidnapping is cognizable non-bailable; FIR mandatory at local station immediately
File habeas corpus if child kidnapped by other parent for custody enforcement
Kidnapping for ransom; FIR immediately; special investigating team usually formed
Acid attack is cognizable non-bailable; FIR mandatory; emergency response
File human rights complaint with NHRC against state if protection was inadequate
Approach Women's Commission for support and victim rehabilitation assistance
Rash driving cognizable; FIR when injury or significant property damage occurs
File MACT claim for compensation if accident caused injury or death
Death by negligence; FIR to establish cause and negligence of accused
File MACT claim for compensation for negligent killing in road accident
Unlawful assembly members; FIR to be registered against all identifiable members
Rioting FIR is primary action against all participants in rioting
FIR for rioting punishment section registered with 141 and 146 together
Bigamy is cognizable; FIR to be filed by aggrieved spouse
File divorce petition to dissolve second or first marriage on grounds of bigamy
Cohabitation by fraud; FIR to be filed by victim woman
File petition for divorce from fraudulent marriage in family court
Election bribery; FIR at local police station or report to Election Commission
File RTI to get election expenditure details if payments suspected undisclosed
Public nuisance is non-cognizable; NC complaint at police station
File mandamus petition if municipal authority fails to remove public nuisance
File NGT complaint if nuisance is environmental in nature causing pollution
Obscene material sale cognizable; FIR to be registered
Seizure of obscene material to be done under court order alongside FIR
Counterfeiting currency is cognizable; FIR mandatory; RBI and police involved
FIR against receiver of stolen property alongside main theft FIR
File cyber crime complaint when cheating occurs through online digital medium
Cyber crime like hacking must be reported to cyber crime cell or portal first
Identity theft online to be reported to cyber crime cell with digital evidence
Online cheating by impersonation to be reported to cyber crime portal
Cheque bounce case must follow NI Act procedure; legal notice then Magistrate complaint
Legal notice within 30 days of cheque bounce is mandatory prerequisite before filing
Non-cognizable offence; NC complaint first at police station
Private complaint before Magistrate for statements causing public mischief
Insulting modesty of woman; cognizable; FIR to be filed
Approach Women's Commission for additional support and action
File maintenance petition under CrPC 125 simultaneously for financial support
File child custody petition if children are being denied access or taken away
File contempt petition if court orders regarding investigation are not followed
After arrest of accused file for bail denial extension if accused applies for bail
Attempted acid attack cognizable; FIR immediately; treat as attempt to murder
Wrongful restraint cognizable; FIR to be filed
Wrongful confinement cognizable; FIR to be filed immediately
File habeas corpus if person is illegally confined by private party or authority
